```{r, echo=FALSE}

library(FactoMineR)

```


# Data exploration
```{r, echo=FALSE}
str(dat)
```

# Create new dataset 
[levels=c("Not like me at all","Not like me","Somewhat like me","A little like me","Like me","Very much like me"),labels=c("1", "2", "3", "4", "5","6")]
```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
dat.new <- dat %>%
  dplyr::mutate_at(c(22:41),funs(recode(.,"Not like me at all"=1,"Not like me"=2,"Somewhat like me"=3,"A little like me"=4,"Like me"=5,"Very much like me"=6)))
dat.new[,22:44]<-lapply(dat.new[,22:44],factor)
str(dat.new)
```

## Dataset for clusterization
```{r, echo=FALSE}
dat.clust<-dat.new[,c(2:4,6:21,22,23,31,32,33,41,
                    26,27,28,36,37,38,
                    24,25,34,35,
                    29,30,39,40,42:44)]
str(dat.clust)
```

# 1. Clusterisation based on 20 value variables (hierachical clusterisation)
Returning the optimal number of clusters is 2
```{r, echo=FALSE}
set.seed(123)
hc <- agnes(dat.clust[,20:39], method = "ward")
fviz_nbclust(dat.clust[,20:39],FUN=hcut,method="wss",k.max=10)
fviz_nbclust(dat.clust[,20:39],FUN=hcut,method="silhouette",k.max=10)
```

Dataset with clusters
```{r, echo=FALSE}
sup_grp<-cutree(hc,k=2)
dat.hc<-cbind(dat.clust,sup_grp)
dat.hc$sup_grp<-as.factor(dat.hc$sup_grp)
summary(dat.hc)
```

## 1.1. Description of the 2 clusters by 20 value variables
### By plots with unweighted data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
plot(catdes(dat.hc[,c(20:39,43)],num.var=21)) # colored responses for p-value <= 0.01
```

Note: The red color is for significantly positive associations between the clusters with responses, for example cluster 2 positively associated with responses of 5 and 6 for many SV questions, which means the proportions of participants chose these responses are significantly higher in the Cluster 2 than the global (averages)â€¦ The darker the color is, the smaller the p-value of the v-test is. From this, we can identify characteristics of each cluster and how the variables associated with each other.

### By statistical results with unweighted data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
catdes(dat.hc[,c(20:39,43)],num.var=21)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}

```
